entry.title: [DEFUNCT] Post-clustermempool Package RBF
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the behavior of transactions within a mempool, emphasizing how the presence or absence of a transaction affects the outcome when submitting a cluster of transactions. Specifically, it highlights an example involving two transactions, labeled `A` and `B`. The key point is the differentiation in outcomes based on whether transaction `A` is already present in the mempool prior to the attempt to submit both transactions together as a cluster (`A+B`). If `A` exists in the mempool, it is identified and removed from the submission (deduplication process), allowing only `B` to be accepted. Conversely, if `A` is not found within the mempool at the time of this bundled submission, the system rejects both transactions, `A` and `B`. This explanation underscores the importance of the mempool's state in determining the acceptance or rejection of transaction clusters.
